docs.snippet: Uruguayan central bank announces on Nov 1 that peso has been devalued by 4.98%, 8th devaluation in 8 mos; says new official rate is 673 pesos to purchase 1 US dollar and 680 pesos per dollar sold
docs.abstract: Uruguayan central bank announces on Nov 1 that peso has been devalued by 4.98%, 8th devaluation in 8 mos; says new official rate is 673 pesos to purchase 1 US dollar and 680 pesos per dollar sold

headline.main: Uruguay Pares Peso 4.9% For 8th Trim in 8 Months

docs.snippet: Uruguayan ex-Min Peirano held and questioned for several hrs, Nov 1, about $10-million Govt loan allegedly misused by his bank

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 1 (Reuters) -- President Juan M. Bordaberry has named the third cabinet of his sevenmonth-old administration in a reshuffle prompted by the resignations Sunday of three ministers angered at the military arrest of Senator...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 1 (Reuters) -- President Juan M. Bordaberry has named the third cabinet of his sevenmonth-old administration in a reshuffle prompted by the resignations Sunday of three ministers angered at the military arrest of Senator Jorge Batlle Ibanez.
docs.abstract: Uruguayan Pres Bordaberry names new Cabinet following resignations on Oct 29 of 3 mins angered at mil arrest of Sen Batlle, head of dissident faction of Bordaberry's Colorado party; army says Batlle injured mil honor in radio broadcast in which he criticized mil; new Cabinet includes 4 new appointments, 5 unchanged posts and 2 temporarily unfilled positions

headline.main: Jean McIntosh, L. L. Jones Jr. Wed in Capital

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 12 -- Following is a listing of the members of the United Nations for 1972-73, with officers, committees, specialized agencies and other bodies:
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 12 -- Following is a listing of the members of the United Nations for 1972-73, with officers, committees, specialized agencies and other bodies:

docs.snippet: UN Gen Assembly, 98-6, votes on Nov 14 for resolution condemning Portugal for waging 'colonial wars' in her African territories; resolution calls on UN members to give 'all moral and material' assistance to groups carrying on armed rebellion in...
docs.abstract: UN Gen Assembly, 98-6, votes on Nov 14 for resolution condemning Portugal for waging 'colonial wars' in her African territories; resolution calls on UN members to give 'all moral and material' assistance to groups carrying on armed rebellion in Portuguese Guinea, Mozambique and Angola; US, GB, Spain, Brazil, S Africa and Portugal voted against measure

docs.snippet: The reputed leaders of two international heroin-smuggling rings were indicted yesterday on charges of conspiring to smuggle more than 1,100 pounds of heroin, valued at $250-million, into the United States between January, 1968, and April, 1971.
docs.lead_paragraph: The reputed leaders of two international heroin-smuggling rings were indicted yesterday on charges of conspiring to smuggle more than 1,100 pounds of heroin, valued at $250-million, into the United States between January, 1968, and April, 1971.
docs.abstract: M Nicoli and C David, reputed leaders of internatl heroin-smuggling rings, are indicted in Fed Dist Ct, Bklyn, NYC, on Nov 17 on charges of conspiring to smuggle more than 1,100 pounds of heroin into US between Jan '68 and Apr '71 after extradition from Brazil at request of US Justice Dept; are detained in lieu of $2.5-million bail; their activities discussed; defendants illus; other members of rings named as conspirators include: L Bonsignour, M Deniz, J Munoz, W Perrin, J Christian, M I Delgado, C R Colombo, P Navarro, C Aparacio, A Hisrch, L Brique, D Vuille Dit Bille, D Padron, C Zippo, G Casalini, C Pastou, J F Marazzini and P R Pasqualini

headline.main: BIG HEROIN RINGS SMASHED BY U.S.; LEADERS INDICTED; Narcotics Crackdown Here Focuses on 2 Frenchmen Brought From Brazil TWO HEROIN RINGS SMASHED BY U.S.

docs.snippet: The reputed leaders of two international heroin-smuggling rings were indicted yesterday on charges of conspiring to smuggle more than 1,100 pounds of heroin, valued at $250-million, into the United States between January, 1968, and April, 1971.
docs.lead_paragraph: The reputed leaders of two international heroin-smuggling rings were indicted yesterday on charges of conspiring to smuggle more than 1,100 pounds of heroin, valued at $250-million, into the United States between January, 1968, and April, 1971.

headline.main: BIG HERON RINGS SMASHED BY U.S.; LEADERS INDICTED; Narcotics Crackdown Here Focuses on 2 Frenchmen Brought From Brazil TWO HEROIN RINGS SMASHED BY U.S.

docs.snippet: Christian David, the alleged kingpin of one of the world's largest heroin-smuggling rings, chose here yesterday to go to prison in the United States for narcotics trafficking rather than face the French guillotine for murder.
docs.lead_paragraph: Christian David, the alleged kingpin of one of the world's largest heroin-smuggling rings, chose here yesterday to go to prison in the United States for narcotics trafficking rather than face the French guillotine for murder.
docs.abstract: C David, alleged kingpin of 1 of world's largest heroin trafficking rings that reptdly conspired to smuggle $250-million worth of heroin into US between '68 and '71, and who was recently extradited to US by Brazil to face narcotics charges, pleads guilty on Dec 2, Fed Dist Ct, Bklyn, and receives 20-yr prison sentence and is fined $20,000; US Appeals Ct postpones trial of A J Ricord, major internatl narcotics trafficker who was extradited to US from Paraguay on similar charges

headline.main: A Heroin Smuggler Chooses U.S. Prison Over the Guillotine; Heroin Smuggler Chooses U.S. Prison Over Guillotine
